contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "or vinegar that people make from strong drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
You can make clear the understood information. AT: "The priest must present also ... the drink offering to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: The priest must present also ... drink offering

contextId.information: The missing words may be added to make the meaning clear. AT: "instead taking all of the firstborn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
You can make clear the understood information that Aaron died. AT: "like your older brother Aaron died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The words "of an ephah" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

The words "of an ephah of fine flour" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters of fine flour" or "two tenths of an ephah of fine flour (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

The words "of an ephah of fine flour" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters of fine flour" or "two tenths of an ephah of fine flour (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

The words "of an ephah" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

These are names of kings who ruled two separate kingdoms. AT: "the kingdom of Sihon ... and the kingdom of Og" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: the kingdom of Sihon ... and of Og
